text: Chasing the Moon is a 2019 television documentary series by Robert Stone about the race to land a man on the Moon. It includes archival footage not seen previously by the public. ==Episodes== Episodes were each about 1 hour 48 minutes in length, covering the history of the US space program from 1957 to 1969. 1\. A Place Beyond the Sky: begins in 1957 and tracks early efforts by the United States to catch up with the Soviet Union in the space race. 2\. Earthrise: covers the years 1964 to 1968, particularly the Apollo 1 and Apollo 8 missions. 3\. Magnificent Desolation: Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin's Apollo 11's lunar landing in the Lunar Module Eagle, the return to Earth of the command module Columbia, the mission's cultural impacts in the US and internationally, and its legacy. ==Broadcast== Chasing the Moon was made for PBS and first broadcast on its American Experience program in July 2019 over three successive nights. It was among the documentaries and dramas screened that month to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the Apollo 11 lunar landing. ==See also== *Apollo 11 - similar in content *Apollo 11 in popular culture ==References== ==External links== * Category:Films about the Apollo program Category:Documentary films about the space program of the United States Category:2010s American television miniseries Category:Cultural depictions of Buzz Aldrin Category:Cultural depictions of Neil Armstrong Category:Cultural depictions of Michael Collins (astronaut) Category:Films set in 1969
